name: General Culinary 10 Quiz | Food & Drink | 5 Questions

questions.text: What is the pudding traditionally served during a marriage ceremony in India called?
questions.explanation:
Payasam.

	Payasam is the Sanskrit term for 'kheer', a delcious rice pudding usually served now as a desert dish.  It consists of rice, milk, sugar, spices and nuts or raisins.

questions.text: Who was the author of the work which included the 'Dinner at Trimalchio' scene and its elaborate culinary wonders?
questions.explanation:
Petronius.

	The work in question was Petronius's masterpiece 'Satyricon'.  Petronius lived during the 1st century AD.

questions.text: What French dish has a name that literally means 'pot on the fire'?
questions.explanation:
Pot-au-feu.

	Pot-au-feu is a simple stew that consists of beef, assorted vegetables and various spices.  The variations of this stew are simply endless!

questions.text: What oriental spice is called Vietnamese coriander in English?
questions.explanation:
Rau ram.

	It may also be called Vietnamese mint or hot mint.  Rau ram is used as a garnish for spring rolls or soups.  It's very delicious!

questions.text: One of the biggest food staples in the world, what percentage of starch does rice contain?
questions.explanation:
80.

	Rice is the largest food crop in the world, just ahead of corn and wheat.  Most rice is cultivated in Asia, as you can imagine. Thank you for trying this quiz!
